title: Use timeline icons for note categories in DevlogDetails
description: Improve the notes list UI in DevlogDetails component by using different timeline icons for different note categories instead of showing the category text. This will make the timeline more visually appealing and easier to scan.

notes.content: Starting implementation by creating category-to-icon mapping and updating Timeline component

✅ Successfully implemented timeline icons for note categories:
- Added imports for new icons (ClockCircleOutlined, ExclamationCircleOutlined, MessageOutlined, PlayCircleOutlined, SolutionOutlined)
- Created getCategoryIcon function that maps categories to colored icons:
  - progress → PlayCircleOutlined (green)
  - issue → ExclamationCircleOutlined (red)
  - solution → SolutionOutlined (blue)
  - idea → BulbOutlined (yellow)
  - reminder → ClockCircleOutlined (orange)
  - feedback → MessageOutlined (purple)
- Updated Timeline.Item to use dot prop with category icon
- Removed category text from timestamp, leaving only the time ago text
- No compilation errors detected
Abstracting note category functionality to lib for better reusability and maintainability

✅ Successfully abstracted note category functionality to reusable library:

**Created `/lib/note-utils.tsx`:**
- `NoteCategoryConfig` interface for type-safe category configuration
- `noteCategoryConfig` object with all 6 categories (progress, issue, solution, idea, reminder, feedback)
- `getCategoryIcon()` - returns React node with colored icon
- `getCategoryLabel()` - returns human-readable label
- `getCategoryDescription()` - returns usage description
- `getCategoryColor()` - returns hex color code
- `getNoteCategoryOptions()` - returns array for select components

**Updated DevlogDetails component:**
- Removed local `getCategoryIcon` function
- Added import from `@/lib/note-utils`
- Cleaned up unused icon imports that are now in the utility
- Timeline still works correctly with abstracted function

**Benefits:**
- Better code organization and reusability
- Type-safe with NoteCategory type
- Consistent styling across components
- Easy to extend with new categories or modify existing ones

Completed: Successfully implemented timeline icons for note categories and abstracted functionality to reusable library. The notes timeline now uses colored icons instead of text categories, providing better visual organization and a cleaner interface. All functionality has been moved to /lib/note-utils.tsx for maximum reusability across the application.

context.businessContext: Better visual organization of notes makes it easier for developers to quickly scan and understand the type of information in each note entry
context.technicalContext: Modify the DevlogDetails component to map note categories to appropriate Ant Design icons and use them in the Timeline.Item dot prop
acceptanceCriteria: Timeline items show appropriate icons for each note category
Category text is removed from note timestamp
Icons are visually distinct and meaningful for each category
Icons maintain good contrast and visibility
